Posts.Content: Hi Yvonne Your bound to feel like this youve had a major operation I felt exactly the same after my masectomy the anesthetic can take about a week to leave your body I felt in pain couldnt sleep because i was so sore on side of the op felt exausted but  I was told by my district nurse to listen to my body thats what you need to do just give it time and get plenty of rest Babs xx
Posts.Title: Had my operation

Posts.Content: Hi mistymoley thanks for the sound advice im off to docs tomorrow need something  and it dosent help that my son split up with his wife 4 mths ago and every phone call hes off loading his worries to me i love him to bits but sometimes it gets a bit wareing  BABS
Posts.Title: FEELING SO DOWN

Posts.Content: Hi I read that article and found it very helpfull also went to see a female doctor she was very understanding gave me amitryptiline as i have breast pain occisionally have had it before quite a while ago for nerve pain she said it will help the pain, help me sleep which it has ive had 3 decent nights sleep since and feel so much better also its a mild antidepressant so hopefully it will be helpfull for all, she wants me on it for atleast 6 mnths Take care Babs xxxx
Posts.Title: FEELING SO DOWN

Posts.Content: Hi George and Jackie Thanks for the suggestion ill make sure I read it Babs
Posts.Title: FEELING SO DOWN

Posts.Content: Hi allme Il make sure I read the article we certainly do take a battering Im still deciding wether to have reconstruction aswell I really value the advice thanks Babs
Posts.Title: FEELING SO DOWN

Posts.Content: HI Im 20 mnths down the line from diagnosis and masectomy been on tamoxifen ever since I thought I was doing so well up untill recently mood wise, I know Ive had bad and good days since diagnosis but I feel so low at the moment not sleeping properly constantly worrying, having to drag myself out of bed not really interested in work  I work for my husband we have our own business good job hes very patient, ive found that since diagnosis and going on tamoxifen I feel rubbish every morning spoke to my consultant she wants me to persevere on it I was told at my last app with breast cancer nurse last year that it can take up to 2 yrs to start getting back to some kind of normality every twinge pain im down at the docs was never like that before went through a period where I was very positive but at the moment cancer is on my mind the doc wont give me antidepressants  dosent think they would be beneficial Is there anyone thats going through or been through it I would be gratefull for any advice  sorry about the moan I used to be on this sight all the time found it very helpfull Babs xx
Posts.Title: FEELING SO DOWN

Posts.Content: Thanks Ethel it makes a lot of sense what you say that makes me feel slightly better ill try and gain axcess to those books hopefully they will help im also going back to docs to see if i can get anything to help me sleep  Babs xxx
Posts.Title: FEELING SO DOWN

Posts.Content: Hi Thanks for the support and advice  Babs
Posts.Title: FEELING SO DOWN

Posts.Content: Hi all its babs hope everyones ok ,Im now on day 6 after mastectomy felt fine up to and  over the weekend quite upbeat had a good talk to the district  nurse when shes come every day, and had company from work brought lots of pressies   and relatives, now im sat on my own hubbies at work and the tears have started even while im writing  this, stuff keeps going through my mind have my results from nodes and lump and breast tissue tests on fri so a bit anxious about that just want to get past that bit and ill know then what i have to face thats probably whats causing the tears and too much time to think has anyone else felt like this after there op im also not having drain out till tues as its draining too much has to come out on 7th day anyway no matter what so thats been a total pain carrying  that about, everyone keeps saying how strong im being and i allways have been a strong positive person but at the moment theres someone inside me screaming out saying im not strong at the moment im going to have to stop typing as i cant stop crying will speak later   babs xxxx
Posts.Title: had a nice weekend but feeling realy low today

Posts.Content: Thanks patricia once id had my bit of a cry i felt a bit better spoke to the district nurse when she came out and she also said to let it all out to keep it in would make things worse she said its quite often a morning ocurance shes dealt with quite a lot of women dealing with cancer and said its quite normal to feel like this in the morning its true because i feel better as the day goes on,shes taken my drain out today which is great and dressings off so i can have a shower tonight and no carrying my handbag around with me, my husband made me laugh when i rang him this morning and told him how i felt and he said what brought that on love i thought men, sometimes i think they walk around oblivious to things anyway thanks for making me feel better speak soon   babs xx
Posts.Title: had a nice weekend but feeling realy low today

Posts.Content: HI SARAH im feeling a bit better tonight me and my hubbie were tearfull when he came home said hes felt emotional most of the day trying to run his business and keeping me strong and  like me dealing with all this and trying to keep him strong aswell had a glass of wine each so were both fairly chilled im trying to stay off the wine at the moment but i thought blow it we need it we had a bit of a talk saying how we both felt and its cleared the air a bit i think he needs to talk more about how he feels ive suggested that i speak to the district nurse when she comes round on thurs about councelling she said she can refer us both i think it might help us, i feel like im treading through treacle emotionally at the moment also sometimes i feel my children just want to block it out as when they txt me and ask how i am and i say im feeling a bit upset they just dont bother replying its probably there way of coping in trying to ignore the situation i know its very difficult for them, the drains out now so i can actually have a shower tonight what a luxury oh well ill stop waffling, hope your ok and ill be thinking of you on thurs speak soon   babs xxxx
Posts.Title: had a nice weekend but feeling realy low today

Posts.Content: Hi nelly bean I to am like you and know how you feel,  Im only 8 wks post mx op  and 3 mths after diagnosis my life was so busy with all the apps and now im just on tablets I was told I didnt need chemo/rads which I was very pleased about  ive no more apps till nov which is just routine follow up,  I just feel like the world has stopped we both probably feel like this because as my bc nurse said that everything happens so quickly from the start and when it all stops your in limbo but i feel personally i need to  try and start getting on with my life and not keep dwelling on things but like you its very hard to move on once your diagnosed your life changes i now set myself small tasks/ goals each week things to look forward to, like going to a concert recently having a wknd away seeing my friends who i never saw much as i was working full time am still off sick, im changing my job it was too stressful and working with hubbie instead, he has his own business and im making a list of everything that ive allways said im going to do,and am now determined to do them hope this helps take care   Babs xxx
Posts.Title: after treatment

Posts.Content: Thanks saxxy d The advice is great thankyou im allways a bit nervous about ops even though ive had 5 in my life time youd think id be used to it by now and allways have a reaction to the anesthetic  i bought some bio oil so ill start using that straight away after the op also the dr recomended zinc and high dose vitamin c which weve both been taking for a week  im trying to stay positive ill be a lot better once ops over with and yes ill be glad when im back to normality will speak soon   babs xxx
Posts.Title: feeling a bit low having mastectomy tomorrow

Posts.Content: Hi hilary Any advice would be great im having right breast removed and as im right handed how does that affect your movement, whats recovery like, i know its a stupid question but i allways sleep on my right side so any tips on that would be useful, also are you in much pain afterwards i do have a quite good pain thresh hold though what happens with the drains how long before you can start doing normal things like going out of the house on your own so anything really speak soon   babs xx
Posts.Title: feeling a bit low having mastectomy tomorrow

Posts.Content: oh sammyk im so so sorry i cried when i read ur post im tearfull anyway as i lost my mum 11 weeks ago then diagnosed with breast cancer 3 weeks later and fighing all  the feelings so i know what ur going through emotion wise its very hard seeing someone close go through this i really hope the treatment works and you can spend much valued time with your sister. your not a depressive or selfish its normal that your feeling this  because you love your sister very much and at times of emotion in your life its probably ur sister you normally turn to but cant at the moment because shes the one sufferring at the moment why dont you ring up the macmillan nurses on this site they are great giving so much support guidance and advice also stay on this site as it is so supportive to theres lots of peaple who can help  so dont be a stranger were here for you to have a good cry rant or scream take care lots of big hugs for you and your sister babs xxxxx
Posts.Title: Sister has just been diagnosed with secondary Liver Cancer

Posts.Content: HI babs again   Having mastectomy tomorrow  feeling a bit down  not slept well husbands has had a cough for 10 days hes going back to docs today, i've  now started with sniffles today worried they wont do it really  need to get this over and done with and get this blighter out and get onto the next hurdle of treatment  etc and also i wish my hubbie would talk more when i need him to its like he just wants to block the cancer out i know its his way of trying to cope but id prefer it if he would discuss it  a bit more this site is really helping  because i can have a moan like now and not be judged, my friends have been very good i can have a good chat with them, oh well im off  to see the nuclear science person today for the dye to be put in for tomorrows  op, can anyone give me any advice on mastectomys speak soon   babs x
Posts.Title: feeling a bit low having mastectomy tomorrow

Posts.Content: Hi sue Just general really what happens on the day recovery afterwards the cancer nurse hasnt said much really having radiotherapy 5/6 weeks later not having reconstruction till later as my sons wedding is in 3 1/2 weeks they want me to recover properly first said if i had both done straight away i wouldnt be well enough so any advice really thanks x
Posts.Title: feeling a bit low having mastectomy tomorrow

Posts.Content: Hi glad everthing went well with the op you just need to listen to your body and rest take care babs xxxx
Posts.Title: op day tomorrow

Posts.Content: Hi The hospital I use is Burnley General lancs Im not due to see my consultant now until Nov a year after my last visit  so wont be seeing anyone again till then I think the idea is really good when I i used to go most of the other breast cancer women were allways with partners so did not want to strike up a conversation and intrude I also went to East Lancs hospice for a six week session and talking to everyone there helped when it finished we all lost touch with each other as the sessions dwindled down to just me as some of the other ladies were not well, the private hospital in Blackburn I think has monthly sessions so I kept meaning to ring them up I think reading your blog has now persuaded me into contacting them as I dont really have anyone locally who has gone through the same thing, I sometimes need someone to talk to my familly are pretty good but  I sometimes think that now Im 2yrs down the line they seem to assume that Im fine so when I try to discuss things about it its like there not really listening and dont understand that im still going through it physically and emotionally my husband has his own business and I also work there in the office hes all ways so wrapped up with the job, says he trys to understand but I dont think he really does anyway less of the moaning, oh by the way my son lives in Huddersfield Babs xx
Posts.Title: Could I suggest buddy system? You could have a bosom buddy too :-...

Posts.Content: Hi Magr20 I had a single masectomy 2012  I took a good book some magazines and my fluffy dressing gown and  comfy slippers, the same possibly some snacks I felt a bit drowsy and sore after but was up and about an hr later after the op It depends on how long your in I was in and out the same day good luck for tomorrow youll be fine will be thinking of you Babs xx
Posts.Title: op day tomorrow

Posts.Content: Hi Flute Im so sorry to hear what a tough time your having its bad enough having to deal with our circumstances, You definately  have come to the right place you will get lots of support and advice as every one here are at different stages and I have found it has helped me so much, even though my circumstances are different I have still found it very hard dealing with my condition I am now 20 mnths down the line had a masectomy and now on Tamoxifen at first my hubbie and grown up children were very supportive and I suppose they are still there for me but because ive had all my treatment and apps with the consultant and not seeing her again until Nov and because I look reasonably well they seem to think I am over the diagnosis which I am not  I like you still feel like I am in a bubble and stuff is going on around me, my BCN also said there will be a new normal which I can understand that because we have to some how get on with our lives, It might be an idea to see if there are support groups locally maybe ring the local hospice or speak to your BCN  or the Macmillan nurses on here, they normally know of this information, set yourself goals either each week or each mnth so you have something to look forward to also treat yourself occasionaly   and of course come on here it will really help you. You take care Babs xxx
Posts.Title: I feel so alone

Posts.Content: hi trishag ive been on Tamoxifen which i think is similar for 2 yrs ive now gone from osteoarthritis to osteoporosis still have joint pain cant walk very far without feeling it  i also get pins and needles in hands if i lean on them too long they go numb this all started since starting on Tamoxifen i was told by my breast cancer nurse this was to be expected so have to put  up with it for another 3 yrs babsx
Posts.Title: Another query re Letrozole

Posts.Content: hi  I had a dexa bone scan 2wks ago because ive been in a lot of pain in my back and right hip i did have osteoarthritis now ive been told that ive now got osteporosis wondering if the tamoxifen has caused this or not helped  ive been on tamoxifen for nearly 2 yrs has anyone had this problam the doctor wants me to take calcium and alendronic acid im not happy
Posts.Title: osteoprosis is it the tamoxifen

Posts.Content: Hi I had my mastectomy and 3 lymph nodes removed yesterday i like you was so worried about the ansethetic but you dont remember much, when you wake you feel youve only been asleep for couple of mins  and they take great care of you i came home later in the day feel sore, achy and tired today and im listning to my body just waing for district nurse to come round youll be fine if you feel nervous tomorrow ask them to give you a pre med which makes you feel very relaxed i had it and it works im sure everything will go well will be thinking of you take care big hugs let me know when your ready how you got on   babs xxx
Posts.Title: MX tomorrow and lymph node clearance....

Posts.Content: Hi Lindy welcome to the site sorry though that your on here, but youll get lots of advice, & support  i have found the site great its helped me a lot,  im 58 and  i was diagnosed in june 2012 had mx in july my life has been a roller coaster of emotions but 6 mths down the line it is getting better cross fingers, you will be weepy i still get down days now, l have been told its quite normal part of the recovery i think once you start your treatment youll feel that something is happening to fight off the problam, try and stay positive if you  feel tearfull  have a good cry  or shout ,  get up every morning and try and enjoy that day, dont google and dont take notice of statistics were all on here for each other big virtual hugs Babs xxx
Posts.Title: Hello, I'm a newbie

Posts.Content: Hi annabel Im so glad you had a lovely holiday ive told my husband that when im fully recovered that hes taking me away somewhere for a week he never takes time out as he runs his own business, i really know how you feel im the same ive got the results of my mastectomy tests on 10th aug , im now on day 7 after the op, and am the same on pins  cant look forward to next week even next month my husband was talking about our retiremnt and i was screaming inside thinking horrible thoughts but i have to stay positive, as you say taking each day as it comes but its constantly messing with my head it dosnt help when hes at work and im on my own, im sure the chemo has done its job and will carry on doing so blasting the little things into oblivion, try and stay positive and your not moaning its good to come on this site keep talking giving you lots of big hugs for tomorrow  take care   babs xxxx
Posts.Title: Terrified of ONC appt tomorrow :(

Posts.Content: hi i totaly agree with the other comments  you have nothing to justify to her its her problam you really need to use all your energy in your recovery and  take no notice of her youve got enough to contend with try not to let this affect you your worth more than that keep coming on here as i do its a great source  of reassurance sympathy and guidance its been my lifeline i hope this resolves itself take care babs xxxxx
Posts.Title: Accused of making it up

Posts.Content: Hi annabel Im so glad you had a lovely holiday ive told my husband that when im fully recovered that hes taking me away somewhere for a week he never takes time out as he runs his own business, i really know how you feel im the same ive got the results of my mastectomy tests on 10th aug , im now on day 7 after the op, and am the same on pins  cant look forward to next week even next month my husband was talking about our retiremnt and i was screaming inside thinking horrible thoughts but i have to stay positive, as you say taking each day as it comes but its constantly messing with my head it dosnt help when hes at work and im on my own, im sure the chemo has done its job and will carry on doing so blasting the little things into oblivion, try and stay positive and your not moaning its good to come on this site keep talking giving you lots of big hugs for tomorrow  take care   babs xxxx
Posts.Title: Terrified of ONC appt tomorrow :(

Posts.Content: Hi ive had reiki by one of the masters and other reiki healers  and im a definate convert the master who is a friend has offered to come round when im better and im definatly going to have it, it so helps stress its helped me   in the past , it makes you feel so relaxed i had one session done a few years back and the reiki healer put her hand on my lower back and said id got a kidney infection and id got one at the time and was on antibiotics that was my first of many  sessions i was quite freaked out at the time thinking how did she know i was a complete sceptic at the time and im not  now, i cant see the reiki affecting your chemo its just complimentry healing ive been signed up for one of those 8 weeks complimentry healing programes at the local hospice and im sure reiki was mentioned so try not to worry about it and enjoy it babs xxxx
Posts.Title: Complementary therapy - Reiki

Posts.Content: Hi lady muck Welcome to the most brilliant site ever, have been on it now for about 3 1/2 weeks its been a great help, diagnosed with ductal and lobular cancer had small lump plus something in lobe area in right breast they decided to do a full right  mastectomy last tues 31 st as they found something else small in the breast did it to reduce the risk also 3 nodes removed went in and came out the same day  came round fairly quickly im recovering well not much pain more discomfort than anything have drain in for one week which goes in my little shopping bag, feel a bit lopsided the surgeon didnt do a reconstruction straight away as ive got my sons wedding in just over 2 weeks and she said it would take too long to recover for it so im having mine later having prosthesis in,  in meantime, it takes a bit of getting used to but you literally take each day as it comes small steps as they say i dont think it looks too bad im just glad the little blighters gone take great care keep coming on here its full of good advice   babs xxx
Posts.Title: Hi, I'm new

Posts.Content: Hi I have been on tamoxifen since aug 2012 and at the time people on the site were taking it at night because of hot flushes i decided to take it in the morning about 7-8 am with my other meds I havnt really had any major side affects only slight water retention in legs slightly achy joints and dry skin hope that helps   Babs xxx
Posts.Title: tamoxifen advice

Posts.Content: Hi im still a newbie been on sight  3/4 weeks welcome to an absolutly briiliant site/forum,  ive now had single right mastectomy tues this week inlcuding lump in breast and 3 node removal hoping its all gone now everything gone for testing will know results on 10th and recovering well  didnt have recontruction straight away as my son is getting married in 2 1/2 weeks and the doctor said i wouldnt have recovered enough so possibly having it later depends on wether i need radiotherapy/chemo or not, i was totally emotional at first like a rollercoaster ride but a lot calmer now the way ive coped is enjoy each day you will get through this set yourself little goals and when youve gone over one hurdle you know youll get over the rest  if you need to ask anything dont hesitate to ask no matter how small keep coming on the site it really has helped me take great care hugs babs xxx
Posts.Title: Hi, I'm new

Posts.Content: Hi i had mastectomy 2 1/2 mths ago and im now on tamoxifen i felt so depressed up until 1 wk ago i suddenly said to myself i cant carry on like this and dont have a huge control over these circumstances and i snapped out of it and feel tuns better the way we all feel is quite normal weve had such a lot to contend with once treatment has stopped you feel what next but were survivours now and cant let this take over maybe having a routine would help i force myself to getup the same time every day and find something to look forward to each day giving yourself a purpose to carry on my bc nurse said these feelings like you feel is quite normal not to beat yourself up for feeling like this the mind has to heal aswell as your body
Posts.Title: Had all treatment & feel terrible!

Posts.Content: Hi Sascha Im so Sorry your feeling like this, but dont know what advice to give except im here for you i so know where your coming from , i was fine at first when i had my mx in july now im just like you hate my body as its a constant reminder of my condition im the same advised not to have reconstruction yet, the scar pulls constantly even though i did my exercises religously it might be an idea to speak with your consultant about physio for your arm it should really be more flexible now i would have thought , i hate anyone with a cleavage like you, also when i went to town recently to get  mastectomy bras there was such a very small choice i could have cried, hopefully sascha as time goes on we'll hopefully start getting used to it  try and keep your chin up  take care    Babs xxxx
Posts.Title: Does it stay llike this?

Posts.Content: Hi tinkers you are one amazing lady well done for getting through it all you are an inspiration to all of us it gives us  hope, im only 3 weeks post mx and day 4  on tamoxifen my oncologist and breast cancer nurse hasnt mentioned anything about blood tests only ive got to have a bone density scan keep the positive attitude and youve got a lovely future to look forward to big hugs   Babs xxxx
Posts.Title: Finished my treatment today!

Posts.Content: Hi ALME So sorry your having to go through this I was in a similar situation worked at a nursing home when I was first diagnosed the job was so stressful  and long hours had wanted to leave for a bit the diagnosis gave me the kick up the !!!!!! that i needed im now in a part time job that is enough hours but not too many doing something completley different working in an office maybe working self employed for you may suit your circumstances finding something different to do less taxing on your mind and body I feel better since leaving the other job, what  job were you thinking of doing, hope you manage to make the change and start enjoying life take care Babs xxxx
Posts.Title: job v self employed as shattered n stressed all the time!

Posts.Content: Hi annie am really pleased for you youll feel much better after surgery i certainly did and youll actually be getting somewhere so glad you saw the right person and  here's to the future good luck big hugs   babs xxxx
Posts.Title: never thought would be so happy to have surgery!!

Posts.Content: Hi i feel a bit better reading your posts  in 2009 i had the same problam kept weeing all the time had a scan and they found a terratoma benign tumor on my left overy that was removed, which they said was pressing on my bladder ive only one overy left and had a hysterectomy in 1994 so thats all ive got left in that department im waiting for my scan app hope that its just the tamoxifen and not something else ill keep you posted funny enough its started to settle down cross fingers ill try and keep positive take care   Babs xx
Posts.Title: bladder problams on tamoxifen?

Posts.Content: Hi every one havnt been on here  in a while  due to work hope your all doing ok, I just want some advice or suggestions have been on tamoxifen since aug 2012 after mastectomy, in the last few months ive had problams with my bladder the first two episodes i was  diagnosed with infection the most recent one which im still suffering now for two weeks with dosnt appear to have shown any infection when dip sticked they sent it away aswell the dr seems to think the tamoxifen is causing the problam as she said its stripping the eostogen from my body and making everything dry internally and externally making me more prone to infections has any one had problams whilst on tamoxifen with there bladder im now waiting for a acan sick of feeling like this felt i was turning a corner then get something else     love babs
Posts.Title: bladder problams on tamoxifen?

Posts.Content: HI elder so sorry to hear the news i also so sympathise with how you feel i was first diagnosed with ductal cancer and they delibrately extended the time between first diagnosis from the core biopsy to app with cancer nurse/consultant, theres me thinking i was going in for a little chat about the result and treatment plan which was take the lump out and radio and pills , to getting a phone call to say the tests had also shown up lobular cells aswell and i had to go for an MRI scan which did show up something else above the lump so at app they decided to reduce the risk saying  it  was better i had a full mastectomy i was so in shock when i came out thinking why didnt they tell me that at first and i could have prepared myself for it better, BUT ive now had my mastectomy now day 7 since op, and im recovering well but still have to go back on 10 th aug for results of tests theyve done again on lump also breast tissue and 3 nodes they took out so im on pins i actually balled my eyes out yesterday and when my husband came in from work we then were  also tearfull together but im keeping myself occupied trying not to think about it all and keep saying im going to beat this as you will if you think back to years ago when there wasnt as much help with early diagnosis and treatments and people are living to a ripe old age now  as we will so that should give us hope with how quickly everything is done and th treatment plans they offer, and thats what keeps me going my auntie had breast cancer in her fifties and is now 85 yrs so that gives me hope, youll have a lot of wobbly moments as we all have had on this sight, just  try and deal with each day and each hurdle as i am and you will get through this and theres nothing wrong with crying  lots of big hugs   babs xxx
Posts.Title: Different day, different diagnosis. Now it is HER2+

Posts.Content: Hi  I have been on Tamoxifen for 2yrs 3 mnths I had side affects at first hot flushes joint pain and tiredness was going to ask for a change but my oncologist ask me to persist with it which I have,Its not as bad now and tolerable. Babs
Posts.Title: Alternative to Tamoxifen?

Posts.Content: Hi its babs Have been for results and they were good , the cancerous lump was still a grade 2 but the mri scan id had 2 weeks ago had showed something else  it was the start of another cancerous lump in the same breast so the cancer nurse said thad id definately made the right decision in having the mastectomy as its now got rid of it my nodes were clear so the cancer hasnt spread both my husband and myself burst into tears in the office i think it was all the strain building up, i have to now take tablets for 5 years dont need radio or chemo and will need  mammograms every year she said im not cured but will be managed and treated hubbies treating me to tea tonight hope everyones ok well all keep fighting this take care all speak soon   babs xxx
Posts.Title: best onc app ever

Posts.Content: Hi Jelly   I am so thrilled for you too what great news sounds like the treatment is doing its job blasting the little so and so's to oblivion how many treatments do you have left and what will happen after, are you going to take tablets as well  keep us informed will speak soon take great care   babs xxxx
Posts.Title: best onc app ever

Posts.Content: Hi elaine  thankyou ,Hope everything goes well for your app i will be constantly  thinking of you whats a WLE ?  your a strong girl like me its true every stage is very hard i said to my hubbie yesterday i feel like ive been to hell and back but all of you on this site have helped so much i couldnt have got through without you keep me informed of your progress big hugs speak soon   BABS XXXX
Posts.Title: best onc app ever

Posts.Content: hi Winston hope your doing  ok im going to ring my bc nurse again tommorow im probably worrying too much i feel a bit low at the moment still grieving my   mums death and every thing else, which is blowing every thing out of proportion im still tender from the op  and arthritis is very painful which is not helping thanks anyway ill let you know how i get on, on a good note hubbies taking me away for 4 days this wknd its probably what i need   Babs
Posts.Title: slight small swelling under existing bust after right sided mx on...

Posts.Content: hi winston well ive rung my bc nurses now two days on the trot and she still hasnt got back to me good job my problam wasnt  that urgent anyway im not to worried about the problam as i think its either my flabby skin or a bit of fluid im seeing my doc next week so ill get hi to look at it
Posts.Title: slight small swelling under existing bust after right sided mx on...

Posts.Content: Hi its Babs have been on tamoxifen for 5 weeks now ( a ) im aching more arthritis is playing up is this normal side affect, also i noticed last nite a slight small swelling under existing left breast might have been there all the time but only noticed it now probably over sensitive at the moment, have had right sided mx 8 weeks ago the swelling is  towards the centre of my rib cage is very soft to touch is slightly tender to touch, i  have been quite sore in that area any way since op,  and had swelling previously across right scar had to have it drained twice could it be fluid from having 3 lymph nodes removed or im not sure wether its just fatty tissue because iv no breast the other side and its like ive had a fat lift if i sit down there is a  small fatty area on the right in the same place  tried to get hold of my cancer nurse waiting for her to ring back has anyone whos had one breast mx had any swelling under other bust  or is it just me being paranoid    Babs xxx
Posts.Title: slight small swelling under existing bust after right sided mx on...

Posts.Content: hi winston i take the previous msg all  back my bc nurse rang at 4.30 and would like to see me next week for an hour to talk over things i think she realises how down i am at the moment and said shes glad glad im realising this now and not trying to struggle through it allso im glad im going to be able to have a good chat with hershe said she can discuss things to help as im trying to deal with bereavement  and the diagnosis
Posts.Title: slight small swelling under existing bust after right sided mx on...

Posts.Content: Hi rusty Welcome to an absolutely brilliant site it has so helped me,and it will help you get through this aswell i was diagnosed 3 weeks ago and was devastated felt fit and healthy before then suddenly felt ill even though i new i wasnt it was just the cancer playing tricks with my mind as i found that it is quite normal i too was diagnosed with a grade 2 ductal lump but have since been told theyve also found lobular cancer cells aswell which means it could have spread to the lobes so might need a mastectomy you will feel your on a roller coaster that cant be controlled which is quite normal but youll get through this just concentrate on what you do each day and enjoy little moments of that day, have goals, i allways say little steps, there will be hurdles to overcome but go through one and prepare yourself for the next listen to what your experts say and follow there lead, and you will get through, this is how im coping also keep talking and keep coming on this site it really helps take care big hugs   babs xxx
Posts.Title: New to all this!!

Posts.Content: Hi Debs well done for finishing all your treatment its a great achievment , i feel exactly the same had mx 3 wks ago and now on tamoxifen for 5 yrs still sore form op and have occasional low days i dont feel at all normal even though ops done and on the pesky cancer zapping drug im waiting for the day when i can stop thinking about cancer, you are so entitled to rant it really helps coming on this site as its helped me i think for the normal thing it will probably take a while, the body and mind need to recover properly keep talking it really helps big hugs Babs xxxxx
Posts.Title: When do i get "Me" back

Posts.Content: Hi Elaine Youll be absolutely fine, i was quite nervous before but i kept myself occupied ,im now on day 6 and recovering really well i dont even bother what  i look like as long as the little blighter ( lump ) has gone, theres more discomfort than anything not much pain district nurse has been coming out every day to check the drain and she advised to keep taking the painkillers even though i dont feel much at the moment as their keeping every thing under control she said, i carry my drain around in a little bag my 3 yr old grandson bought me and put it in a carrier bag when in bed you soon get used to it ive been pottering about, dont where a bra at the moment and putting on loose fitting tops, having drain out on tues they only keep it in for 7 days max sometimes can come out before if it drains less and less i cant wait to have a shower im having strip washes every day hubbie washes my hair, everything will go well, keep coming on the site it really helps take care big hugs   babs xxx
Posts.Title: now had mastectomy and recovering

Posts.Content: Hi its babs Had op on tues also 3 node removal the dye had gone into the 2 nodes under the sentinal node so all 3 were removed plus the lump and  breast, the doctor said he couldnt feel any cancer in the nodes apparently you can ? and the 2 ultra sounds i had were also clear previously in that area so hes slightly confidant, but hes sent the nodes and lump and breast tissue off for testing anyway just in case theres any cells there cossing everything there isnt  ,he said if they dont find anything in nodes and  as ive had the complete breast off i might not need radiotherapy just the tablets for 5 yrs app to see him is on 10 th aug so ill be doing a lot of praying till then im recovering quite well from the op up and pottering having to do daily exercises  hubbies been brilliant doing everthing before and after work im getting a bit bored of daytime tv but forceing myself to rest and making the most of it will speak soon hope everyone else is ok
Posts.Title: now had mastectomy and recovering

Posts.Content: Hi Yvonne that is so lovely and such good news were all in it together its funny we have all posted our thoughts on here and have never met each other but we all understand each other and going through the same thing you will find you will be coming on here often even down the line because everyone on here understands what your going through and it so helps i dont know what i would have done without it  its so good that you have turned a corner its now onwards and upwards take care Babs xxxx
Posts.Title: A massive thank you to every one xxxx

Posts.Content: Hi its paranoid babs have been on tamoxifen for just over 2 weeks now have not really had any side affects except 1 week after taking it i have developed swollen glands in my neck feel a tight feeling have been to drs she said its a virus i of course being paranoid think it might be the tablets has anyone had this affect or is it what the dr has said can anyone help saying that have been feeling a bit run down, havnt been on the site for a bit feeling a bit low at the moment but have been keeping track of whats going on hope every ones ok   hugs to every one babs xxx
Posts.Title: 2 weeks on tamoxifen swollen throat glands is it a side affect ?

Posts.Content: Hi shelley I,ve just had right sided mastectomy this tues plus 3 node removal and feel fine problam is my mind wants to do things and my body says no feel very tired most of time body appears to be healing well occasional pain more uncomfortable under armpit than across the breast just a pulling feeling there taking regular pain relief as advised and doing my exercises religously and resting plenty youll be absolutely fine i went in and had op in the morning and was back home at 8.45 pm same night just make sure you rest but keep occupied mentally will be thinking of you lots of hugs   babs xxx
Posts.Title: Scheduled for MX on Friday - a few questions

Posts.Content: Hi Id just like to say a big thankyou to everyone  for all your lovely replies i would not have been able to get through all this without all of you girls your tips and support have been brilliant im still coming on here regularly have still got a long way to go yet take care all and big hugs to everyone   BABS XXXX
Posts.Title: A big thankyou

Posts.Content: sascha please dont go you have helped me through all of this i agree with everyone else you can choose to read what you want and dont want we all have our down days and staying will get you through yours please come back your friendb    babs xxxxx
Posts.Title: Wishing everyone well and goodbye

Posts.Content: Hi Joanne I can totally understand how your feeling I was like that at first, Im almost 2 yrs post diagnosis and masectomy now on Tamoxifen I started a daily diary for the first couple of months  and now I sometimes  read it on the days when i feel low and realise how far ive come I was constantly like that but as each day passes now Im getting further away from diagnosis and the trauma, it is very hard at first but you will get through it and there will come a time when you dont think or worry about it as much, if you keep yourself occupied talk a lot have a good cry when you need it and of course come on here as there are people at different stages that will help you also there are some good referance books from macmillan that will help and there free just ring there no big hugs take care  Babs x
Posts.Title: Feel so alone

Posts.Content: Hi yvonne I had mx surgery 5 1/2 wks a go and had swelling  under scar the  whole time its only just going down now said it was seroma and was painfull , after drains were taken out had to have the area drained twice but i think the fluid is now disapearing on its own , was always painfull before drainage, Im sure it could be that  also strained muscles can be very painfull try not to worry youve have major surgery so your bound to have a lot of pain hope everything goes well with your app, take care big hugs Babs xxxxx
Posts.Title: Lump under mastectomy scar

Posts.Content: Hi sorry to hear the news, when i read your post i was a bit taken a back because my doctor has just told me only last week that i had symptoms of costochondritis I also have  been to 2 other drs previous to that with the same problam   I had my op last july 2012 (mx), the past couple of months i have had tenderness and pain to touch at my sternum and under my good left breast only hurts when i do anything strenuous  though, he it didnt seem  to think that it was cancer related,  but after reading your post it prompted me to contact my bc nurse who is now trying to get an earlier app with the consultant so i can get checked, try and be strong as i am trying to also if you want to private message me thats ok Babs xxxx
Posts.Title: Secondary Breast Cancer with Bone and Lung Mets.......feeling very...
